content.content: Tl;Dr I’ll be spinning up an open call Friday’s to help explore the Endgame and hopefully steer DVC calls  towards actionable feedback on this MIP-set.  Context We need to facilitate DVCs in a more structured way. I’m noticing no one is taking action on this, so, in the spirit of feedback & RFC, I’m happy to spearhead a few weeks of workshops. By surfacing topics and coordinating themes, the community members who can attend Rune’s DVC’s should have more of an open conversation. Ideally, feedback is published back here on forums so it can be modified/rejected/clarified async. It just so happens that @0xdeniz coordinated a series of workshops with facilitation experts mischief makers that were all about workshop facilitation ( so meta ). I’m channeling that experience into Facilitating some DVC’s; here is the suggested formatting: Intention: Open up a new DVC meting without the proposal author, to shape feedback, ask questions, and articulate concerns about theEndgamee. Desired outcome: Focusing feedback on useable artifacts (lists, fig jams, forms, etc.) and looping back around to the Weds/Thurs DVC’s (at minimum). Ideally, through the month of RFC we use the Weds/Thurs  DVC time in a more actionable way, with structured conversation. Agenda: For this Friday, since it’s shorter notice, it will primarily be about prioritizing the endgame MIPs for discussion and figuring out a workshop format that works. starting agenda:  Welcome, walkthrough and intro ~5 mins Icebreaker 5 mins Define challenges (ask One high level question) <10mins break (5 mins) MIP breakout group(s) align and assign (5 mins) Breakout sessions  (15 mins)  if we have enough time:  Vote & cut (3 rounds; 2 mins a pop) (or async vote) Closing, flex time, and follow-ups (5 mins)  Rules:  I’ll use my Zoom & Figma account(s) and record (but not post to youtube). I think an open forum that isn’t published is needed. Open to suggestions outside of zoom; discord works fine too. For once, camera-on if possible. Try to enjoy ourselves; workshops should shake up the status quo and feel more high energy. Show up and be present.  Roles:  Attendees: I would love it if some MKR holders could attend, but anyone in the community with concerns and a collaborative mindset are welcome. Facilitation (time-wizard): That me   Organizer: Open to a second meeting organizer  don’t all stand up at once.  Time: 7:30 am PST | 10:30am EST | 14:30 PM UTC  Edits Figjam link (view only until start time) Greatly reduced agenda because online calls are hard to coordinate.

Just wish we’d started these sooner! Considering how much Endgame has evolved just since the DVC meetings started, a stronger/more organized back-and-forth like this would have made that time even more fruitful.
Great initiative, I’m looking forward to see what results are produced from this

Calendar link Call details: Join Zoom Meeting: Launch Meeting - Zoom Meeting ID: 870 0552 7061 Passcode: 131587 I’ve gotten some feedback that the agenda is packed and since this post is globally pinned I will try to get more space in there for discussion/focus. Will hopefully get the figjam link + edits here in a few hours.

ClausClowes:  how much Endgame has evolved   Great callout, this is precisely “why now?” The endgame went through a lot of iterations, and now that mips are here, we can organize the comments at least a little,  producing necessary feedback so there is a back and forth.

Summary We met and fulfilled the agenda above (16 participants at peak). We created an artifact for the community. We chose not to record the call so opinions could float more freely. As a result, we got high level and specific with the endgame MIPs. There is definitely more feedback to surface and ultimately iterations to execute. Detailed feedback The most cogent and aligned feedback has been delivered to appropriate threads, Endgame v3,  the clustering MIP, POVE, and the offboarding MIPs (Events) and ( SH ) (apologies for the offboarding repetition). If you want to see anything else from the session that Figma link is open to view.  What to expect this week   New time: Friday 8 am PST. Making space for the SES update. Another workshop format, the same Figjam link. It will open up Friday morning and then view only again after concluding. (DM me if you have revisions or want to sharpen figjam fingers; sometimes practice helps) Slightly changing agenda with another activity to open and get contributor brains working. I will continue to serve as a nexus for the next EG-RFC-DVC to see if we can incorporate changes or have a discussion about how to proceed. I will leave my suggestions where appropriate and hopefully bring some operational guidance as the month progresses.   Learnings  Icebreakers are fun; look to this Friday for an even more enjoyable beginning to the meeting. Not everyone has used Figjam (solution: I will help anyone with 10 mins to get comfortable providing feedback and using the tool if they plan on attending.) Vote rounds and condensing is difficult on the fly and even more challenging async. Spent the weekend researching that conundrum and would love to bring polls back here as a solution for soft consensus. All contributions anonymize after the call concludes. I’m simply migrating most contributions to the forums directly, as they are far more concise and topical than I could ever manage alone.
Missed the last session but reviewed the Figjam and this looks great! Great initiative @twblack88  Will try and attend the next call.

Tomorrow Intention: Focus endgame DVC meting without the proposal author, producing actionable feedback and one community high level insight. The ultimate TL;DR Desired outcome: Focusing feedback on useable artifacts (lists, fig jams, forms, etc.) and bringing those to Weds DVC’s to set up a working session. Agenda: For Friday 9-16, apologies for waffling, we’ll vote on 1 of two agendas:  no 1.  Welcome, walkthrough, and agenda vote ~5 mins Icebreaker go post a joke about pegs on jokedao 10 mins Steelman thread: align and categorize from LFW’s feedback ~ 10mins break (5 mins) How might we’s 15 mins (5 mins x 3 rounds) Prioritize & decide via dot-votes (2-3 rounds; 3 mins a round) Closing & flex-time 6 mins   no 2:  Welcome, walkthrough, and agenda vote ~5 mins Icebreaker go post a joke about pegs on jokedao 10 mins  Meta-nomics breakout sessions (20 mins) break 5 mins Vote & cut (2-3 rounds; 4 mins a round) Closing & flex-time 7 mins  Rules:  Zoom + Figma . No recording. Anonymized contributions afterwards. For once, camera-on if possible. Try to enjoy thinking alone, together. There is power in quietly coordinating. Show up and be present. If you need to dial in via phone just say so at the beginning! So someone can team up as post it wrangler.  Same Roles:  Attendees:  community in collaboration mode, MKR holders, CU members. Lets go.   Facilitation-wizards: That me and maybe @Retro

Agenda for tomorrow  Welcome, walkthrough ~5 mins Warm up (15 mins) Immediate Blockers if these pass <10m ( a riff on stinky fish, getting this in the open for transparency) break (5 mins) Strategy Pyramid (20 mins) Closing & flex time (5 mins)  Rules:  Zoom + Figma . No recording. Anonymized contributions afterwards. For once, camera-on if possible. Try to enjoy thinking alone, together. There is power in quietly coordinating. Show up and be present. If you need to dial in via phone just say so at the beginning! So someone can team up as post it wrangler.  Desired outcome: Create an artifact that fills in some gaps about the overall Endgame strategy, jam on values and ideals. Roles:  Attendees: community in collaboration mode, MKR holders, CU members. Lets go.   Facilitation-wizards: That me and perhaps some @SES-Core-Unit guest stars.

Friday Summary  We produced the last artifact on the figjam. We wrote out values, where we’ve gained/lost, and the immediate unknowns to Endgame. We ended up filling out a decent portion of a strategy map.  Overall I’ve been assembling the takeaways from this month into a presentation. Not sure if it will be perfect by the 28th, but I will try.

Just a quick confirmation: tomorrow’s RFC call will merge with the SES update. Anyone attending will be encouraged to red team some software ideas ( feel free to correct me on this @wouter ). From there, we’ll take a week off to consider the next iteration of the Friday calls. Cheers
@twblack88 do you have a link for the next call details? Hoping to join this time.

The link is going to stay the same, we’re off this week while MIPs get formally submitted. The RFC mission is done and it’s time for a new one. Happy to pivot these and continue to hold space for the community and would love to make them actionable. Some suggestions came up today:  Host clustering teams to develop operational standards and MIP-i-fy them; also surface challenges with product-led narrative framing and perspectives. Hold space for research & documentation. Aiming for producing usable frameworks. <your idea here>
Okay thanks. I thought so but it was still showing an RFC call in the global Maker calendar (which I finally tracked down) so I was confused. Thanks for taking initiative on this!
No formal endgame call with an agenda today; due to devcon and no concrete outcome we can focus on. But I’ll hop on that zoom if anyone want’s to cowork and chill.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
